Perform Multi-Omics Integration

run_multiomics_integration.Rd

Integrates multiple assays in a MultiAssayExperiment object using either MOFA+ or MCIA.

Usage

run_multiomics_integration(
  expomicset,
  method = "MCIA",
  n_factors = 10,
  scale = TRUE,
  action = "add"
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment object containing at least two omics assays.

method

A character string specifying the integration method. Options: "MOFA", "MCIA". Default is "MCIA".

n_factors

An integer specifying the number of latent factors/components to compute. Default is 10.

scale

A logical indicating whether to standardize (Z-score) the assays before integration. Default is TRUE.

action

A character string specifying whether to store ("add") or return ("get") the results. Default is "add".

Value

A MultiAssayExperiment object with integration results added to metadata (if action = "add") or a list with:

method

The integration method used ("MOFA" or "MCIA").

result

The trained integration model.

Details

This function:

  • MOFA+ (method = "MOFA"):

    • Creates a MOFA model from expomicset.

    • Trains the model using default MOFA parameters.

    • Saves and loads the trained model.

  • MCIA (method = "MCIA"):

    • Applies NIPALS MCIA via nipalsMCIA::nipals_multiblock().

  • Scaling: If scale = TRUE, all assays are standardized using .scale_multiassay().

  • Output Handling:

    • "add": Stores results in metadata(expomicset)$integration_results.

    • "get": Returns a list containing method and result (trained model).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
expom <- run_multiomics_integration(
  expomicset = expom,
  method = "MCIA",
  n_factors = 10,
  scale = TRUE
)
} # }
